thread.title: Short-footed Gators looking for a placekicker
thread.title_full: Short-footed Gators looking for a placekicker

author: Edgar Thompson
title: Short-footed Gators looking for a placekicker
text:
Florida has two injured kickers who have combined to miss four of the past six field-goal attempts 
If next week's Florida-Georgia game comes down to a field goal, things could get very interesting. 
Both teams are struggling with their kicking games. 
The Gators' issues reached the point of desperation on Monday. With kickers Jorge Powell and Austin Hardin battling injury, the team took to Twitter seeking walk-ons to try out for the Gators. 
Powell replaced starter Austin Hardin four games ago but was injured while covering a kickoff Saturday night at LSU. After not travelling to Kentucky or Missouri, Hardin made the trip to Baton Rouge. But during warm-ups was clearly uncomfortable as he repeatedly stretched his right leg and hip and walked gingerly. 
Neither Florida kicker has been reliable. The Gators have missed four of their past six field-goal attempts - 34 (twice), 35 and 36 yards. Three of those misses are by Hardin. 
Powell also missed an extra point Oct. 3 against Ole Miss and sent a kickoff out of bounds Oct. 10 at Missouri. 
Powell's best moment as Florida's kicker was his tackle of Tennessee returner Evan Berry as he was breaking free up the sideline. 
Coach Jim McElwain lost faith in his kicking game to point he passed a 40-yard field-goal attempt at Missouri to try a fake. Punter Johnny Townsend was tackled for a three-yard loss. 
Meanwhile, Georgia senior Marshall Morgan of Fort Lauderdale is struggling. Considered one of the SEC's top kickers entering the season, Morgan has missed four of 13 attempts this season. 
Morgan did make three field goals, including a 34-yard game-winner, during this past week's 9-6 against Missouri. But four minutes prior to the game-winner he missed from 26 yards. 
One option for the Gators is Brooks Abbott, who spent last season with the team after he transferred from Virginia Tech. 
Upon seeing Florida's need for a kicker, Abbott tweeted, "Maybe time to lace them back up." A little later, he confirmed on Twitter he would try out Wednesday. 
Email Edgar Thompson at egthompson@orlandosentinel.com . Read the Swamp Things blog at www.orlandosentinel.com/swampthings . Follow our UF coverage on Twitter @osgators .
